docs.lead_paragraph: FATAL STREET ENCOUNTER On Friday afternoon Coroner SOHIRMER took the ante-mortem deposition of ROGER LAFTUS, a native of Ireland, 20 years of age, who lay at the point of death in the New York Hospital in consequence of a wound in his arm, received on New-Year's Eve, in an affray at the corner of Worthstreet and Broadway. docs.snippet: In this Court, before Judge MCCUNN, yesterday, John Cordon, indicted for burglary, pleaded guilty in the third degree, and was sentenced to State Prison for five years, the Court remarking, in passing sentence, that a person like the prisoner, with...

headline.main: Court of General Sessions.; A BATCH OF THIEVES AND BURGLARS FOR SING SING.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court, before Judge MCCUNN, yesterday, John Cordon, indicted for burglary, pleaded guilty in the third degree, and was sentenced to State Prison for five years, the Court remarking, in passing sentence, that a person like the prisoner, with the advantages of health and youth to assist him in gaining an honest livelihood, had no claim for sympathy, and deserved the full penalty of the law.

docs.snippet: Of the recent biographical works which have issued from the press in increasing numbers both in this country and in England, none has equal interest at the present moment, to Americans, with this of Gen. QUITMAN.

headline.main: NEW PUBLICATIONS.; LIFE OF GEN. QUITMAN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The news which we publish this morning fully confirms the accounts telegraphed from Charleston relative to the Star of the West, which appeared in the TIMES of yesterday. docs.snippet: The U.S. Mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. SHUFELDT, arrived yesterday afternoon, from Havana, after a very pleasant voyage. She left Havana last Saturday, the 5th inst., at 1 P.M.

headline.main: Later from Havana.; ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY--ANOTHER SLAVER CAPTURED--A WRECK--BUSINESS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. SHUFELDT, arrived yesterday afternoon, from Havana, after a very pleasant voyage. She left Havana last Saturday, the 5th inst., at 1 P.M.

docs.snippet: In this Court yesterday, before Judge LEONARD, the testimony in the case of SELOVER, indicted for ticket-swindling, was resumed.

headline.main: Court of Oyer and Terminer.; TRIAL OF SELOVER FOR TICKET SWINDLING-VERDICT OF GUILTY.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court yesterday, before Judge LEONARD, the testimony in the case of SELOVER, indicted for ticket-swindling, was resumed.
